title: About
text: Doan Nam Long Vu (Vũ Đoàn Nam Long) finished his Master and Bachelor degree at Technical University of Darmstadt. He did B.Sc. research with Prof. Steffen Eger and Dr. Nafise Sadat Moosavi, M.Sc. research with Prof. Yufang Hou and Prof. Ivan Habernal at TU Darmstadt.

title: About
text:
Research Interest
Natural Language Processing: Affective Computing, Machine Translation, Information Retrieval, Evaluation Metrics for Text Generation
Privacy Preserving Techniques: Differential Privacy, Cryptographic Protocol
Applicaton: Mental Health

title: About
text:
Hobbies
In my free time, I enjoy doing street workout and swimming in the summer. And in winter, I’m having a ton of fun practicing bass guitar!

title: Doan Nam Long Vu
text: I am a doctoral researcher at MAIN and UKP lab at the Technical University of Darmstadt, working on Artificial Intelligence and Natural Language Processing for Mental Health.

title: Doan Nam Long Vu
text:

Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany

Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany

Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany

title: Doan Nam Long Vu
text:

AI for Mental Health
Natural Language Processing

title: Doan Nam Long Vu
text:
News

09/2024: The paper “Granularity is crucial when applying differential privacy to text: An investigation for neural machine translation” from my Master thesis has been accepted at EMNLP 2024 Findings.
09/2024 Starting from January 2025, I will be joining AI and NLP for Mental Health group lead by Dr. Shaoxiong Ji affiliated with Ubiquitous Knowledge Processing (UKP) Lab at Technical University of Darmstadt as a Full-Time Research Assistant and Ph.D student.
06/2024 A paper accepted at ACL 2024 workshop on teaching NLP describing a course shared task that we organized at the Foundations of Language Technology (FoLT) course in 2023/2024 at the Technical University of Darmstadt. The shared task focuses on evaluating the output of LLMs in generating harmful answers to health-related clinical questions.
05/2024 I got my Master degree and officially graduated!
01/2024: Our paper “DP-NMT: Scalable Differentially-Private Machine Translation” has been accepted at EACL 2024 System Demonstration.
10/2022 I got COLING 2022 Outstanding paper award!
08/2022: The paper “Layer or Representation Space: What Makes BERT-based Evaluation Metrics Robust?” from my Bachelor thesis has been accepted at COLING 2022.
06/2022 I got my Bachelor degree and officially graduated!

title: About
text:
Hobbies and other interests
In my free time, I enjoy doing street workout and swimming in the summer. And in winter, I have a ton of fun practicing bass guitar! I am also interested in Music Source Separation, mainly to extract the bass guitar stem for better music transcription. Besides that, I also like to experience Virtual/Augmented Reality games/softwares.
